Tucson narrows his eyes.  

" I thought I'd get the truth out sooner or lat=
er.  Sorry Rodimus but my battle is NOT with you."  

He turns to Hydras.

=
" In that case Hydras, my battle is with you.  As an Autobot I made a pledg=
e to vanquish all Decepticon kind, and I intend to abide by that pledge."

=
A soft glow of spark energy begins to glow behind Tucson's chest.  As he se=
ems to step closser to Rodimus.  This distracts him somewhat as he looks ba=
ck at his former leader. At this time, his body seems to take on some mass =
that it had not had before, thus increasing his size a bit, to become just =
slightly taller than Rodimus.  

"Huh? What in the name of Primus?"

His bo=
dy, still well shaped, and sleek, continues to take  on more and more of a =
resemblence to that of Optimus Prime.  It was as if this power of his heart=
 were going to the next level.  So eager and willing to bring a comrade out=
 of the darkness that the power of compassion was now acting as if the body=
 itself was possessing the Matrix of Leadership.  Although, no such matrix =
is housed in Tucson's body.  He puts his hand over his chest.

" Optimus...=
. I - think I understand..."

He waits for Hydras to give him his reply.


=

> Hydras:

hy not dedicate your self to be a politican... but You are very WRONG!!!! I=
'm Megatron and Galvatron Fused... I'm one and both... Rodimus has chosen h=
is path and is one of OURS, with him in our said what can STOP us us to rul=
e and Conquest as is our fate? but such loyalty have to be reward it.... Ro=
dimus, defeat this little annoyance and capture him... after you have enjoy=
ed yourself hurtting him"

imus/BlackFortress

> 
>   
> With a lightning reflex, Tucson catches Rod=
imus's punch, with his right hand, and balls a powerful fist around it. He =
concentrates the energy from his all wheel drive systems into that one hand=
 and uses it as a vise around Rodimus's fist. 
> 
> " Trust me, I don't wan=
t to do this Rodimus. I'm not getting any enjoyment out of what I'm doing. =
But if this is the only way to get through to you, then so be it."
> 
> Wit=
h his free hand, Tucson now concentrates the all wheel drive power into his=
 left arm, and manages to twist Rodimus's arms behind him, holding him in a=
 powerful grapple. His hands clamp down painfully hard onto Rodimus's arms,=
 and his grip remains as solid as a powerful vise. 
> 
> " You fail to see =
that what Hydras, Scourge and Cyclonus are doing, is merely using you as a =
pawn. They've tampered with you and have no intentions of giving you power.=
 All they want is the power you possess, and it appears they are succeeding=
 in doing so. I know you have it within you to conquor this hold they have =
over you. You just have to want it bad enough to do it. The Rodimus I know =
would NEVER fall to such low standards. THE RODIMUS I KNOW WOULD BE STRONG =
AND RESIST THE TEMPTATIONS THAT BEFALL HIM! But I see you are not that Rodi=
mus anymore. You have become no better than MEGATRON! IS THAT WHAT YOU WANT=
?! TO HAVE A HISTORY THE SAME AS THE INFAMOUS DECEPTICON LEADER WHO WROTE H=
IS OWN DEMISE?! TO HAVE EVERYONE DESPISE YOU AND WANT NOTHING MORE THAN TO =
DESTROY YOU?! IS THAT HOW YOU WISH TO BE REVERED?! I WILL NOT LET THAT HAPP=
EN! DO YOU HEAR ME, I WILL NOT LET THAT HAPPEN!"
> 
> He finally rams Rodim=
us up against a wall with a powerful slam, and holds him there.
> 
> "BY TH=
E NAME OF PRIMUS I WILL NOT LOSE MY LEADER TO CORRUPTED FORCES!"
> 
> Deter=
mination mixed with rage. It was what Tucson was now feeling. He had been s=
ubdued enough, and now he was itching to show his true colors. Even though =
he had used a bit of brute strength against Rodimus, he takes great care no=
t to damage him gravely.
>

 <supercyclonus@> wrote:

 this either Optimus, and

ssons are learned when you face an

de for many years. But if this were you, I 
> > >trust you would do the sam=
e."
> > 
> > For a moment, as Rodimus stood there before this somewhat smal=
ler Autobot there was a brief moment of clarity, a small instant of indecis=
ion. This Autobot showed a bravery and strength that seemed oddly familiar =
to him. 
> > 
> > >" All right, have it your way Rodimus. This is going to =
hurt me 
> > >more than it will hurt you." 
> > 
> > However the moment pas=
sed as the dark Predacon shell programming that twisted his own kicked in. =
He smiled, as he cracked his knuckles, "You're right, this is *will* hurt y=
ou more than it will hurt me." Rodimus replied in mocking tones. 
> > 
> > =
With a quick motion he stepped foward to snap a quick punch towards Tuscon'=
s head, ready to end this battle with this little upstart Autobot - there w=
as something about him that annoyed him!

and Scourge had stepped back; watching the opening of the battle with looks=
 of eagerness as they studied the moves of both combants.
